DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Storage Reuse Template Study Activity Repeat Quantity ISO21090.URG.INT.NONNEG.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An administrative activity defined at a global library level that is an action of storing samples. The number of times the activity occurs. NOTE(S): If the frequency is more than once a day, this is still interpreted per time, e.g. BID for 5 days = 10 repeats.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen Storage Reuse Template Study Activity Repeat Quantity
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:The act of safekeeping goods in a depository.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective._Make or do or perform again.:How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Biospecimen Storage Reuse Template Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:The act of safekeeping goods in a depository.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.
The act of safekeeping goods in a depository.
Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: Make or do or perform again.:How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.

Concepts.definition: Make or do or perform again.
How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: DEC released per model owner approval. mc 2/2/11

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Constrains URG so that the values are non-negative integers.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
